verses.kjv: For I would that ye knew what great conflict I have for you, and for them at Laodicea, and for as many as have not seen my face in the flesh;
verses.web: For I desire to have you know how greatly I struggle for you, and for those at Laodicea, and for as many as have not seen my face in the flesh;
verses.ct: I want you to know how hard I'm fighting for you — and for the believers in Laodicea, and for everyone who has never met me in person.

verses.kjv: That their hearts might be comforted, being knit together in love, and unto all riches of the full assurance of understanding, to the acknowledgement of the mystery of God, and of the Father, and of Christ;
verses.web: that their hearts may be comforted, they being knit together in love, and gaining all riches of the full assurance of understanding, that they may know the mystery of God, both of the Father and of Christ,
verses.ct: My goal is that their hearts would be encouraged and that they would be united together in love, gaining the full richness of complete understanding, so they can truly know the mystery of God — that is, Christ himself.

verses.kjv: In whom are hid all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge.
verses.web: in whom all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge are hidden.
verses.ct: In Christ, all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge are hidden.

verses.kjv: And this I say, lest any man should beguile you with enticing words.
verses.web: Now I say this that no one may delude you with persuasiveness of speech.
verses.ct: I'm telling you this so that no one deceives you with clever-sounding arguments.

verses.kjv: For though I be absent in the flesh, yet am I with you in the spirit, joying and beholding your order, and the stedfastness of your faith in Christ.
verses.web: For though I am absent in the flesh, yet I am with you in the spirit, rejoicing and seeing your order, and the steadfastness of your faith in Christ.
verses.ct: Even though I'm not with you physically, I am with you in spirit. And it brings me joy to see how well-ordered your lives are and how firm your faith in Christ remains.

verses.kjv: As ye have therefore received Christ Jesus the Lord, so walk ye in him:
verses.web: As therefore you received Christ Jesus, the Lord, walk in him,
verses.ct: So since you have accepted Christ Jesus as Lord, continue to live your lives in him.

verses.kjv: Rooted and built up in him, and stablished in the faith, as ye have been taught, abounding therein with thanksgiving.
verses.web: rooted and built up in him, and established in the faith, even as you were taught, abounding in it in thanksgiving.
verses.ct: Stay rooted in him and built up in him. Grow strong in the faith just as you were taught, overflowing with thankfulness.

verses.kjv: Beware lest any man spoil you through philosophy and vain deceit, after the tradition of men, after the rudiments of the world, and not after Christ.
verses.web: Be careful that you don’t let anyone rob you through his philosophy and vain deceit, after the tradition of men, after the elements of the world, and not after Christ.
verses.ct: Watch out that no one takes you captive through hollow philosophy and empty deception — ideas based on human tradition and the basic principles of this world rather than on Christ.

verses.kjv: For in him dwelleth all the fulness of the Godhead bodily.
verses.web: For in him all the fullness of the Deity dwells bodily,
verses.ct: For the entire fullness of God lives in Christ in bodily form.

verses.kjv: And ye are complete in him, which is the head of all principality and power:
verses.web: and in him you are made full, who is the head of all principality and power.
verses.ct: And in him you have been made complete. He is the head over every ruler and authority.

verses.kjv: In whom also ye are circumcised with the circumcision made without hands, in putting off the body of the sins of the flesh by the circumcision of Christ:
verses.web: In him you were also circumcised with a circumcision not made with hands, in the putting off of the body of the sins of the flesh, in the circumcision of Christ,
verses.ct: In him you also received a circumcision not performed by human hands — your sinful nature was stripped away through the circumcision that comes from Christ.

verses.kjv: Buried with him in baptism, wherein also ye are risen with him through the faith of the operation of God, who hath raised him from the dead.
verses.web: having been buried with him in baptism, in which you were also raised with him through faith in the working of God, who raised him from the dead.
verses.ct: You were buried with him in baptism, and in that same baptism you were raised with him through faith in the power of God, who raised him from the dead.

verses.kjv: And you, being dead in your sins and the uncircumcision of your flesh, hath he quickened together with him, having forgiven you all trespasses;
verses.web: You were dead through your trespasses and the uncircumcision of your flesh. He made you alive together with him, having forgiven us all our trespasses,
verses.ct: You were dead because of your sins and because your sinful nature had not been cut away. But God made you alive together with Christ, forgiving all of your sins.

verses.kjv: Blotting out the handwriting of ordinances that was against us, which was contrary to us, and took it out of the way, nailing it to his cross;
verses.web: wiping out the handwriting in ordinances which was against us. He has taken it out of the way, nailing it to the cross.
verses.ct: He erased the record of charges that stood against us — the written code with all its rules that condemned us. He took it away completely, nailing it to the cross.

verses.kjv: And having spoiled principalities and powers, he made a shew of them openly, triumphing over them in it.
verses.web: Having stripped the principalities and the powers, he made a show of them openly, triumphing over them in it.
verses.ct: He stripped the rulers and authorities of their power and made a public spectacle of them, triumphing over them through the cross.

verses.kjv: Let no man therefore judge you in meat, or in drink, or in respect of an holyday, or of the new moon, or of the sabbath days:
verses.web: Let no one therefore judge you in eating, or in drinking, or with respect to a feast day or a new moon or a Sabbath day,
verses.ct: So don't let anyone judge you over what you eat or drink, or about observing a festival, a new moon celebration, or a Sabbath day.

verses.kjv: Which are a shadow of things to come; but the body is of Christ.
verses.web: which are a shadow of the things to come; but the body is Christ’s.
verses.ct: These things were only a shadow of what was coming. The reality itself belongs to Christ.

verses.kjv: Let no man beguile you of your reward in a voluntary humility and worshipping of angels, intruding into those things which he hath not seen, vainly puffed up by his fleshly mind,
verses.web: Let no one rob you of your prize by self-abasement and worshiping of the angels, dwelling in the things which he has not seen, vainly puffed up by his fleshly mind,
verses.ct: Don't let anyone disqualify you from your prize by insisting on false humility and the worship of angels, going on and on about visions they claim to have seen, inflated with pride by their unspiritual minds.

verses.kjv: And not holding the Head, from which all the body by joints and bands having nourishment ministered, and knit together, increaseth with the increase of God.
verses.web: and not holding firmly to the Head, from whom all the body, being supplied and knit together through the joints and ligaments, grows with God’s growth.
verses.ct: These people have lost their connection to the Head — to Christ — from whom the whole body is nourished and held together by its joints and ligaments, growing as God causes it to grow.

verses.kjv: Wherefore if ye be dead with Christ from the rudiments of the world, why, as though living in the world, are ye subject to ordinances,
verses.web: If you died with Christ from the elements of the world, why, as though living in the world, do you subject yourselves to ordinances,
verses.ct: Since you died with Christ and were set free from the basic principles of this world, why do you still live as though you belong to it? Why do you submit to rules like,

verses.kjv: (Touch not; taste not; handle not;
verses.web: “Don’t handle, nor taste, nor touch”
verses.ct: "Don't handle this! Don't taste that! Don't even touch it!"?

verses.kjv: Which all are to perish with the using;) after the commandments and doctrines of men?
verses.web: (all of which perish with use), according to the precepts and doctrines of men?
verses.ct: All these things are destined to disappear as they're used up. They're nothing but human rules and teachings.

verses.kjv: Which things have indeed a shew of wisdom in will worship, and humility, and neglecting of the body; not in any honour to the satisfying of the flesh.
verses.web: These things indeed appear like wisdom in self-imposed worship, humility, and severity to the body; but aren’t of any value against the indulgence of the flesh.
verses.ct: These rules may look wise with their self-imposed worship, their false humility, and their harsh treatment of the body — but they have no real power to restrain the indulgence of the flesh.
